intro: Rhigozum zambesiacum, commonly known as the Zambesi rockrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in spring. Its leaves are small, opposite, and often covered in fine hairs. Rhigozum zambesiacum is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy plant in its native habitat.
